meanings.sent1: Leaves oxidises when exposed to air.
meanings.sent3: The apple oxidises and turns brown, but it still tastes good.
meanings.sent4: Time oxidises memories, turning them into stories.
meanings.sent5: The fire slowly oxidises the wood, releasing warmth.

meanings.sent1: The metal oxidises over time, forming a patina.
meanings.sent2: Food oxidises if left out for too long.
meanings.sent3: The old car oxidises in the junkyard, becoming part of nature.
meanings.sent4: His anger oxidises into acceptance as time passes.
meanings.sent5: The paint oxidises, giving the wall a weathered look.

meanings.definition: To cause to combine with oxygen
meanings.sent1: The scientist oxidises the metal to study its properties.
meanings.sent2: The bleach oxidises the stain, making it easier to remove.
meanings.sent3: The chef oxidises the wine to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her words oxidises his heart, filling it with love.
meanings.sent5: The process oxidises the substance, changing its color.
